jobDescription: The primary focus of the Data Support Analysts I representative is to manage and support the day to day data transfer processes with an emphasis on proactive customer service. Data Services Support is an internal escalation group that assist Client Engagement, Sales, Relationship Management, and Client Engagement Tech Support with connection and integration related issues through inbound calls or emails. ResponsibilitiesInterface with end user clients to help resolve issues and ensure data transfer efficienciesInterface with internal support teams on escalated issues – both customer and operations basedProactively troubleshoot data transfer issues from a global levelAssist in all facets of data transfer implementationsStays up to date on system releases, new features, and bugsMakes outbound calls or WebEx sessions in response to ticket or email requestProvides a second level of support for account aggregationServices about 9000 internal connection tickets a monthKnowledge of both the eMoney application and the Nexus toolRequirementsBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required; college degree preferredMinimum of 2 years customer service experience requiredTeam Player with the ability to work independently as neededSkillsExceptional communication skills (both written and verbal)Strong analytical and diagnostic skillsDetailed orientedWorking knowledge of MS Office suiteUnderstanding of CRM systemsKnowledge of project based initiativesStrong interpersonal and verbal/written communication skillsStrong organization skills and excellent time management skillsAdept at data and trend analysis
